titleStmt.title: Letter from Robert Scott Newton to Frederick W. Seward, April 23, 1879

bibl.title: Letter from Robert Scott Newton to Frederick W. Seward
Despatches from United States consuls in St. Paul de Loanda, 1854-1893

revisionDesc.change: Creation of individual xml files, review, and addition encoding

opener.dateline: United States Consulate at St Paul de Loanda 23rd April 1879

div1.p: Sir, I have the honor to inform the Department that I leave this day for England via Lisbon per steamer Benguella in conformity with licence granted me for six months in your Despatch No. 71 of 22nd November 1878.
As Mr. Thomas the newly appointed Consul has not yet arrived. I have -- delivered over the Archives to the care of Mr. Andrew Galbraith Colville who will act during my absence.

I have made up the accounts of this consulate to todays date according to consular instructions and have to advise my draft on the Secretary
Secretary of the Treasury for $56.19 in favor of Mr. Frederick A. Silva of Boston. Enclosed is form No. 120.

closer.salute:
I have the honor to be
Sir,
Your most obedient Servant
